subject: ACCA F3 Financial Accounting Section B (MTQs)

tasks.task: Opening inventory = £12,000. Purchases = £40,000. Closing inventory = £15,000. Calculate cost of sales.
State the valuation rule required by IAS 2.
A machine costs £50,000, residual value £5,000, useful life 5 years. Calculate the annual depreciation expense.
Calculate carrying amount after 2 years.
Rent is £3,600 per year, paid up to 31 January 2024. Year-end is 31 December 2023. Calculate rent expense for 2023.
Identify whether the adjustment at year end is an accrual or a prepayment.
Trade receivables = £60,000. Irrecoverable debts = £4,000. Required allowance = 3%. Calculate closing allowance.
Calculate receivables figure to appear in the SOFP.
Contract price = £80,000. Performance obligation completed 60%. Calculate revenue to recognise.
Define 'performance obligation' under IFRS 15.
Repairs £900 recorded as motor vehicles (asset). What is the correcting journal entry amount?
State the type of error involved.
Operating profit = £25,000. Depreciation = £6,000. Increase in receivables = £2,000. Decrease in payables = £1,000. Calculate cash from operating activities.
State one non-cash item added back in operating cash flows.
Cash book = £3,900 (debit). Bank statement = £3,200 (credit). Unpresented cheques = £1,100. Bank charges £50 not recorded. Calculate adjusted cash book balance.
Which item does NOT appear on bank reconciliation statement?
Current assets = £90,000. Inventory = £30,000. Current liabilities = £40,000. Calculate quick ratio.
Define what efficiency ratios measure.
Revenue = £150,000. Cost of sales = £90,000. Distribution = £12,000. Calculate gross profit.
Calculate profit before tax.
Opening balance = £22,000. Credit purchases = £40,000. Payments = £35,000. Discounts received = £2,000. Calculate closing balance.
State one reason the control account may not agree with the list of balances.
Opening balance = £30,000. Credit sales = £55,000. Receipts = £60,000. Irrecoverable debts = £3,000. Calculate closing balance.
State one benefit of maintaining control accounts.
Carrying amount = £80,000. Revalued amount = £95,000. Calculate revaluation surplus.
Where is the revaluation surplus recorded?
A debit entry of £1,200 was omitted. What is the suspense account difference?
State one type of error that does NOT affect the trial balance.
Invoice amount = £10,000. Discount allowed = 5%. Customer pays within period. Calculate cash received.
State whether discounts allowed are an expense or income.
